main event: USAF pilots observed an unidentified flying object over the North Pacific Ocean near the Hawaiian Islands on 8 May 1959.
interesting points: The object was tracked by radar operators for 30 minutes and exhibited erratic flight characteristics., Two pilots confirmed the sighting independently., The object was observed moving at speeds of up to 1,600 mph at an altitude of 45,000 feet., The observation lasted for approximately 14 minutes., The object moved straight in the direction of the observer's aircraft before disappearing.
witness description: USAF pilots of the 85th Fighter Interceptor Squadron
